headline: Why Huntington Ingalls Stock Gained Speed in April
summary: Huntington Ingalls has been a laggard for years, weighed down by low-margin contracts.  Washington is increasingly focused on shipbuilding, which should create opportunities for the company in the years to come.  The U.S. shipbuilding industry has been in a lull since the height of the pandemic, with companies tied to pre-COVID contracts that are not nearly as profitable now.

headline: Huntington Ingalls Q1 Earnings Beat Estimates, Revenues Decline Y/Y
summary: HII's first-quarter earnings beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 30.7%. However, its top line decreases 2.5% from the year-ago quarter.

headline: HII’s Ingalls Shipbuilding Hosts “Signing Day” for Shipbuilder Academy Graduates
summary: PASCAGOULA, Miss., May 01, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- HII’s (NYSE: HII) Ingalls Shipbuilding hosted a “signing day” for the 2025 graduates of its Shipbuilder Academy at the shipyard Wednesday. This year, 43 students were offered full-time positions at Ingalls, marking the beginning of their careers with HII. The “signing day” coincided with National Apprenticeship Day, recognizing the importance of connecting individuals to meaningful careers and assisting employers in building a skilled workforce

headline: Huntington Ingalls (NYSE:HII) Misses Q1 Revenue Estimates
summary: Aerospace and defense company Huntington Ingalls (NYSE:HII) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 2.5% year on year to $2.73 billion. Its GAAP profit of $3.79 per share was 31.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls' quarterly earnings fall on slowing volume
summary: Though demand for submarines and aircraft carriers has remained strong, fueled by China's expanding naval footprint and high global tensions, Huntington Ingalls has been lagging in output due to persistent problems in retaining shipyard labor.  Huntington said in February it aims to increase outsourcing by 30% in 2025 to ease skill gaps within its shipyards.  Ingalls Shipbuilding, one of Huntington's shipbuilding units, saw a slowdown in volume for its assault ships, prompting a 2.7% fall in revenue.

headline: HII Reports First Quarter 2025 Results
summary: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., May 01, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- HII (NYSE: HII) today reported results for the first quarter of fiscal 2025.
